ETYMOLOGY: From Latin illustratio (stem illustration-), from illustrare 'light up, make clear', via Old French illustration.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A picture, drawing, or diagram that serves to illustrate a book, magazine, text, or concept.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 为书籍、杂志、文本或概念所作的图画、素描或示意图；插图。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The children's book was filled with colorful illustrations.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这本儿童书里满是彩色的插图。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An example or instance used to explain or clarify something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用来解释或阐明某事的例子或实例；说明，例证。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The speaker provided several historical illustrations to support his argument.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 演讲者提供了几个历史例证来支持他的论点。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The action, art, or process of illustrating something, especially by creating images for a text.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 绘制插图的行为、艺术或过程；插画艺术。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She decided to pursue a career in illustration after graduating from art school.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 从艺术学院毕业后，她决定从事插画职业。
